result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
-------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Barber

records.addlTxt:
8:49 AM Case called. Defendant John R Barber in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for John R Barber.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dickinson recites agreement: Deft to plead guilty to count 1, dismiss and read in remaining counts, withheld sentence of 18 months of probation, Conditions: court costs, AODA and follow through with counseling as recommended, no weapons, no drugs, no paraphernalia, DNA sample and surcharge. 
State agrees. 
No victim present. 
Weapon to be seized. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Court gives warning to deportation. 
Court orders weapon forfeited.

Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant John R Barber in court with attorney A James Dickinson.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint.   Reading of complaint waived.   Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
